title: Cognitive Load Theory-Based Introductory Programming Project Course

context.prior_knowledge: Basic computer application skills and logical thinking competencies
context.additional_context: Conducted in digital device (laptop/tablet)-provided environments, teams perform programming projects addressing social issues.

learning_goals: Participants can independently complete three or more mini-projects using basic syntax (conditional statements, loops, functions) in Python-based programming environments
Participants can establish step-by-step problem-solving strategies by decomposing complex problems through phased learning designs based on cognitive load theory
Participants can upload team project deliverables to GitHub and create five-minute presentation materials to address peer evaluations and expert feedback

resources: Open datasets for social issue resolution

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
